item.title: Virtual environment
item.description: Why? Virtual environment keeps dependencies required in different projects in separate places. This solution make easier to maintain different projects. How? Installation (for Fedora otherwise use pip): sudo yum install python-virtualenv Creating new env: virtualenv -p /path/to/a/python.exe /path/to/env_name Activating: source /path/to/env_name/bin/activate After finishing the project deactivate Where to store virtual environments? with the project (add folder to the .gitignore) in home directory. Then you can control them by virtualenvwrapper
